name: Big Bands"A" Quiz | Big Band | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the theme song of the Ray Anthony Orchestra?
questions.explanation:
The Man With The Horn.

	Ray was taught music by his father and began playing in the Antonini Family Orchestra.

questions.text: Which of the following bands did Ray Anthony not play for?
questions.explanation:
Tommy Dorsey.

	He started with Al Donahue's "Low Down Rhythm" after his time with the Antonini Family Orchestra. For four years he led a U.S. Navy service orchestra in the South Pacific during World War 2.

questions.text: Which is not a Ray Anthony hit?
questions.explanation:
Theme for "77 Sunset Strip".

	He also had hits with "Nerertheless", "Skokiaan", and"Sentimental Me", among others. He also had a good selling album titled "Dream Dancing".

questions.text: Danny Alvin had an orchestra in the Big Band era but later formed a combo that was better suited for Dixieland. What instrument did he play?
questions.explanation:
Drums.

	As a teen he played drums for Sophie Tucker in New York City. He also once played for Wayne King.

questions.text: The "Manny Albam Orchestra" featured Manny playing what instrument?
questions.explanation:
Saxophone.

	In his early years he played with a series of bands including Herbie Fields, Bobby Sherwood, Sam Donahue, and Charlie Barnet. After Barnet he gave up playing and started arranging and composing. He arranged for Stan Getz, Dizzy Gillespie, and others.

questions.text: What band had the theme song "Deep Blue Melody"?
questions.explanation:
Don Albert Orchestra.

	Don was a trumpet player. His band disbanded in 1939. He continued with other groups throughout the 40's, 50's, and 60's.

questions.text: Steve Allen was popular in this era. Which of the following was not one of his talents?
questions.explanation:
Trumpet player.

	He was also a talented TV personality, author, and comedian. His more noted piano tunes included "This Could Be The Start Of Something Big" and the themes from "Picnic", "Houseboat", and "The Bell Book and Candle".

questions.text: Which is not a Leroy Anderson composition?
questions.correct: Zing Went The Strings Of My Heart
questions.explanation:
Zing Went The Strings Of My Heart.

	He formed his own recording orchestra in the 1940's. His hits were mostly instrumental and along with the above hits were "Horse and Buggy", "Plink Plank Plunk", and "The Penny Whistle Song".

questions.text: Lew Anderson conducted a big band while attached to the submarine service in the Pacific. After that he joined the "Honeymooners" vocal group. Which show were they not on?
questions.explanation:
Perry Como Show.

	He also contributed his talents to numerous radio and TV commercials for sponsors such as Buick, Colgate, Pepsi, and others.

questions.text: Don Albert only recorded 8 songs. Which was not one of them?
questions.explanation:
Liza.

	He was born Albert Dominique and his instrument of choice was the trumpet.
